snippet: The European Central Bank unexpectedly named Peter Praet, a Belgian, as its de facto chief economist, breaking a tradition of having German hard liners in the post.
abstract: European Central Bank names Peter Praet, a Belgian, its de facto chief economist in break from tradition of appointing German hard-liners to the crucial policy-making post.
lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank unexpectedly named Peter Praet, a Belgian, as its de facto chief economist, breaking a tradition of having German hard liners in the post.

headline.main: European Central Bank Picks Belgian as Top Economist
headline.print_headline: European Central Bank Picks Belgian as Top Economist
